crops.name: Tomato
crops.sowing_period: Late winter to early spring (February - April)

fertilizer_schedule.extra_info: Incorporate fertilizer into the soil during land preparation. Ensure even distribution to avoid root burn.
Apply near the root zone and irrigate lightly to aid absorption. Avoid applying during peak sunlight to prevent leaf burn.
Use fertigation for precise application. Monitor soil moisture to prevent over-fertilization.
Apply in split doses to enhance fruit quality. Ensure adequate irrigation to facilitate nutrient uptake.
Apply to replenish soil nutrients. Conduct soil testing to adjust future applications.

pesticide_schedule.application: Spray Copper Hydroxide 50g per 15L water to prevent bacterial diseases
pesticide_schedule.extra_info: Spray early in the morning for better adhesion. Wear protective gear to avoid inhalation.

pesticide_schedule.application: Apply appropriate fungicide for early blight as per manufacturer's instructions
pesticide_schedule.extra_info: Ensure thorough coverage of foliage. Rotate fungicides to prevent resistance development.

pesticide_schedule.application: Spray Chlorothalonil for late blight control
pesticide_schedule.extra_info: Apply during dry weather to maximize efficacy. Avoid spraying near harvest to comply with pre-harvest intervals.

crops.name: Potato
crops.sowing_period: Early spring (March - April) or late summer (August)

fertilizer_schedule.application: Apply FYM 25 t/ha and NPK 100:150:100 kg/ha
fertilizer_schedule.extra_info: Mix FYM thoroughly with soil before planting. Ensure NPK is applied in furrows for uniform distribution.
Apply along rows and cover with soil. Irrigate immediately to enhance nitrogen uptake.
Use fertigation for better absorption. Maintain consistent soil moisture during tuber development.
Foliar application is effective. Apply in the evening to avoid leaf scorching.

pesticide_schedule.application: Spray Malathion 50 EC in 200 liters of water per acre to control cutworms
pesticide_schedule.extra_info: Spray at dusk to target nocturnal pests. Avoid spraying during windy conditions.

pesticide_schedule.application: Apply Cymoxanil 8% + Mancozeb 64% WP at 2.5 kg/ha for late blight management
pesticide_schedule.extra_info: Ensure complete coverage of lower leaves. Reapply after heavy rainfall as per label instructions.
Focus on the base of plants. Use protective equipment during application to avoid exposure.

fertilizer_schedule.application: Apply Urea 35 kg/acre, MOP 100 kg/acre, DAP 50 kg/acre
fertilizer_schedule.extra_info: Apply in furrows before planting. Ensure deep incorporation to prevent nutrient loss.

fertilizer_schedule.application: Apply Urea 1 kg/day/acre, MOP 0.5 kg/day/acre, Magnesium Sulphate 0.5 kg/day/acre
fertilizer_schedule.extra_info: Use drip irrigation for precise delivery. Monitor soil pH to optimize nutrient availability.
Split application into two doses for better uptake. Irrigate after application to aid absorption.
Apply to support cane ripening. Conduct soil tests to adjust nutrient ratios for next season.

pesticide_schedule.application: Drench Chlorantraniliprole 18.5% SC at 150 ml/acre in 400 liters of water
pesticide_schedule.extra_info: Apply to soil around plant base. Ensure thorough drenching for effective root pest control.
Spray during early morning for better pest contact. Avoid application during flowering to protect pollinators.

pesticide_schedule.application: Spray Mancozeb at 25g/L for controlling mould
pesticide_schedule.extra_info: Ensure uniform coverage of stalks. Reapply if high humidity persists.

crops.name: Brinjal
crops.sowing_period: Late winter to early spring (February - April)

fertilizer_schedule.extra_info: Mix into soil during transplanting. Ensure even distribution to promote uniform growth.
Apply as a side dressing. Irrigate lightly to facilitate nitrogen absorption.
Use fertigation for targeted delivery. Monitor soil moisture to prevent nutrient leaching.
Apply to restore soil fertility. Conduct soil testing for future nutrient planning.

pesticide_schedule.application: Spray Neem oil 50 ml/15L for aphids
pesticide_schedule.extra_info: Apply in the evening to avoid harming beneficial insects. Ensure thorough leaf coverage.
Focus on young fruits and flowers. Reapply every 7-10 days if pest pressure is high.

pesticide_schedule.application: Apply Dimethoate 30 EC at 1.5 ml/L for controlling thrips
pesticide_schedule.extra_info: Use protective gear during application. Avoid spraying near harvest to meet safety intervals.

fertilizer_schedule.extra_info: Apply in seed furrows during sowing. Ensure proper mixing with soil to avoid seed burn.
Apply along rows and incorporate into soil. Irrigate to enhance nitrogen uptake.
Apply during early grain filling. Ensure even distribution to support kernel development.

pesticide_schedule.extra_info: Apply as a foliar spray targeting the whorl. Reapply if pest activity persists.
Spray during early disease onset. Ensure coverage of both leaf surfaces.
Apply during tasseling to protect pollinators. Use protective gear to avoid exposure.

fertilizer_schedule.extra_info: Incorporate into soil before transplanting. Ensure uniform application for even growth.
Apply in flooded fields for better absorption. Split into two doses if heavy rainfall is expected.
Apply to support grain formation. Ensure adequate water levels to facilitate nutrient uptake.

pesticide_schedule.extra_info: Apply to standing water for better pest control. Avoid spraying during strong winds.
Spray at the first sign of disease. Reapply after 10-15 days if symptoms persist.
Apply granules to the base of plants. Ensure even distribution to target larvae effectively.

fertilizer_schedule.extra_info: Apply in seed furrows during sowing. Ensure deep placement to avoid nutrient loss.
Apply as side dressing. Irrigate immediately to enhance nitrogen availability.
Use fertigation for precise application. Monitor soil moisture to prevent nutrient leaching.

pesticide_schedule.extra_info: Spray undersides of leaves for better coverage. Avoid spraying during flowering to protect pollinators.
Focus on bolls and flowers. Reapply every 7-10 days if pest pressure is high.
Apply in the evening to minimize impact on beneficial insects. Use protective gear during application.

crops.name: Chilli
crops.sowing_period: Late winter to early spring (February - April)

fertilizer_schedule.extra_info: Mix into soil during transplanting. Ensure even distribution to promote uniform growth.
Use fertigation for targeted delivery. Maintain consistent soil moisture during flowering.
Apply in split doses to enhance fruit quality. Irrigate after application to aid uptake.

pesticide_schedule.extra_info: Spray during early morning for better pest contact. Ensure thorough coverage of young leaves.
Focus on leaf undersides where mites congregate. Reapply after 7 days if infestation persists.
Spray at the first sign of leaf curl. Avoid overuse to prevent resistance development).

crops.name: Mango
crops.sowing_period: Not applicable (planted as saplings in spring, March - April)

fertilizer_schedule.application: Apply FYM 10 kg/tree and 20:20:0 NPK @ 1 kg/tree
fertilizer_schedule.extra_info: Apply FYM in a ring around the tree base. Incorporate NPK into the soil and irrigate.
Apply as a foliar spray for better absorption. Avoid application during heavy rains.
Use foliar application for micronutrients. Apply in the evening to avoid leaf burn.

pesticide_schedule.extra_info: Spray during humid conditions to prevent fungal spread. Ensure coverage of flowers and young fruits.
Spray during early morning to target hoppers. Avoid spraying during flowering to protect pollinators.
Use bait traps in combination with sprays. Apply in the evening to minimize impact on beneficial insects.

crops.name: Apple
crops.sowing_period: Not applicable (planted as saplings in late fall or early spring, November or March)

fertilizer_schedule.application: Apply FYM 30 kg/tree and Urea 500 g/tree
fertilizer_schedule.extra_info: Apply FYM in a ring around the tree. Incorporate urea into the soil and irrigate lightly.
Apply in the drip line of the tree. Ensure soil is moist to facilitate nutrient uptake.
Apply to support fruit development. Use fertigation for precise delivery.

pesticide_schedule.extra_info: Spray during wet weather to prevent scab. Ensure thorough coverage of leaves and buds.
Spray undersides of leaves for better aphid control. Avoid spraying during bloom to protect pollinators.
Apply at petal fall and repeat after 14 days. Use pheromone traps for monitoring.

crops.name: Orange
crops.sowing_period: Not applicable (planted as saplings in spring, March - April)

fertilizer_schedule.application: Apply FYM 25 kg/tree and NPK 19:19:19 @ 500 g/tree
fertilizer_schedule.extra_info: Apply FYM in a ring around the tree base. Incorporate NPK into the soil and irrigate.
Apply as a foliar spray for better absorption. Avoid application during heavy rains.
Use foliar application for micronutrients. Apply in the evening to avoid leaf burn.

pesticide_schedule.extra_info: Spray young leaves for effective control. Reapply every 10-14 days if infestation persists.
Apply at dusk to target nocturnal moths. Use protective gear during application.
Combine with micronutrient sprays for better tree health. Monitor for disease symptoms regularly.

crops.name: Guava
crops.sowing_period: Not applicable (planted as saplings in spring, March - April)

fertilizer_schedule.extra_info: Apply FYM in a ring around the tree. Incorporate NPK into the soil and irrigate lightly.
Apply to support flower development. Use fertigation for precise delivery.
Apply as a foliar spray to enhance fruit set. Ensure application during early fruit development.

pesticide_schedule.extra_info: Use methyl eugenol traps for better control. Spray in the evening to minimize impact on beneficial insects.
Focus on leaf undersides where mites congregate. Reapply after 7 days if infestation persists.
Spray during humid conditions to prevent fungal spread. Ensure coverage of fruits and leaves.

crops.name: Soybean
crops.sowing_period: Late spring to early summer (May - June)

fertilizer_schedule.extra_info: Apply in seed furrows during sowing. Ensure even distribution to promote uniform growth.
Apply as side dressing. Irrigate immediately to enhance nitrogen availability.
Apply to support pod development. Ensure adequate soil moisture during application.

pesticide_schedule.extra_info: Spray at the base of plants for effective control. Use protective gear during application.
Ensure thorough coverage of foliage. Reapply after 10 days if pest pressure is high.
Apply during early pest activity. Avoid spraying during flowering to protect pollinators.

crops.name: Beans
crops.sowing_period: Late spring to early summer (April - June)

fertilizer_schedule.extra_info: Apply in seed furrows during sowing. Ensure proper mixing with soil to avoid seed burn.
Apply as side dressing. Irrigate lightly to facilitate nitrogen absorption.
Apply to support flower and pod development. Use fertigation for precise delivery.

pesticide_schedule.extra_info: Spray undersides of leaves for better aphid control. Avoid spraying during bloom to protect pollinators.
Focus on young pods and flowers. Reapply every 7-10 days if pest pressure is high.
Spray during early disease onset. Ensure coverage of both leaf surfaces.

fertilizer_schedule.extra_info: Apply in seed furrows during sowing. Ensure deep placement to avoid nutrient loss.
Apply as side dressing. Irrigate immediately to enhance nitrogen availability.
Apply to support grain formation. Ensure adequate soil moisture during application.

pesticide_schedule.extra_info: Spray targeting the whorl for effective control. Reapply after 7-10 days if pest pressure is high.
Apply as a foliar spray targeting the whorl. Reapply if pest activity persists.
Spray during tasseling to protect pollinators. Use protective gear to avoid exposure.
